result.execSummary:
The defendant Darin John Sylvester was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Time Served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darin John Sylvester

records.addlTxt: Submit DNA sample within 30 days and pay surcharge

10:11 AM Defendant Darin John Sylvester appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Darin John Sylvester.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001182, 2022TR001183, 2022TR001184, 2022TR001185, 2022TR001186, 2022TR001187 tracking with 22CF104:
Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom.
Atty Burdon states plea agreement. All traffic matters to be dismissed and read-in.   Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 22 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Credit = 17 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge = $200.00
Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on November 1, 2022

2022TR001182, 2022TR001183, 2022TR001184, 2022TR001185, 2022TR001186, 2022TR001187 to be dismissed and read-in

10:11 AM Defendant Darin John Sylvester appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Darin John Sylvester.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001182, 2022TR001183, 2022TR001184, 2022TR001185, 2022TR001186, 2022TR001187 tracking with 22CF104:
Atty Gumz is prepared to proceed today with a plea to the amended charge.  Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the amended criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.

10:13 AM Defendant Darin John Sylvester appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Darin John Sylvester.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
2022TR001182, 2022TR001183, 2022TR001184, 2022TR001185, 2022TR001186, 2022TR001187 tracking with 22CF104:
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Atty Gumz states that the matters are resolved if the court has time to do a plea later.

 BY THE COURT:  Reset to tomorrow
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM Defendant Darin John Sylvester appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant states that he is unable to get an Attorney due to the money.  Court questions the defendant's finances.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney  
Bond continued
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:43 PM Defendant Darin John Sylvester appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does not qualify for PD appointment.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is unsure what he is going to do.  

Court signed a probable cause statement.

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with no special conditions.
Atty Gumz makes bail arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond:
*No special conditions
Initial appearance scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on September 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
